826011971:
[

Data Engineer

Company Name Capgemini Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 224 views

Job description

About the Team


Our Insight and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people.


About the role


The Software/Data Engineer will expand and optimise our clients’ data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimise their data flow and collection for cross functional teams. Your responsibilities include:

  • Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture
  • Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
  • Design, develop and implement data pipelines for data migration & collection, data analytics and other data movement solutions.
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using ETL, Database Replication, Application Integration, SQL and ‘big data’ technologies.
  • Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
  • Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems


About you


You will have the ability to optimise data systems and build them from the ground up. You will support software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.


Essential skills and experience


  • Proven working experience as a Software and/or Data Engineer (preferably with Java or Scala)
  • Technical expertise regarding data acquisitions, data transformation, data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field
  • Experience with cloud services


Preferable skills and experience


  • Knowledge of and experience with ETL technologies (e.g. SAP BO Data Services, SAP PO, IBM Message Broker and IBM Message Queue)
  • Knowledge of and/or experience with Big Data integration and streaming technologies (e.g. Kafka, Flume, Talend etc.)
  • Knowledge of and/or experience with Big Data processing technologies (e.g. Spark with Scala / Java / Python / R)
  • Exposure to migrate data into ERPs (SAP CRM, IBM Case Management etc.), databases (HDFS, HBase, HANA, DB2, Teradata, MS SQL etc)


\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

Full Stack Java Developer (Senior/ Lead)

Company Name Cognizant Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 75 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Our Culture

Your passion, integrity and experience are integral to Cognizant's success. You will be welcomed into a dynamic and expanding global leader in IT and Business consultancy where you will be valued for who you are. We take pride in our partnership with our clients, so your ability to add value and provide exceptional service to our clients are fundamental to your success. In return, you will be empowered with opportunities and support to develop your career and collaborate with people focused on innovation and ideas.

A position you’ll love

Be part of an Agile team of diverse and talented software engineers! In this role, you will work in a collaborative environment to solve complex problems in a meaningful way. In addition, you will provide thought leadership in programming and software development. You will develop code based on client requirements in alignment with best practices such as functional & object-oriented programming as well as test driven development. You will also develop responsive web applications across multiple platforms within large, distributed client environments.

To be successful in this role, you will have the following skills and experience:
  • Proven experience as a Lead or Senior Java Developer;
  • Expertise in Java technologies such as: Spring, Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, JPA, JMS and exposure to other Java libraries and frameworks;
  • Expertise in web technologies such as: Javascript (ES2016+), NodeJS and Browser APIs;
  • Awareness of the 12 factor principles of microservice development;
  • Expertise in designing well-formed RESTful APIs;
  • Expertise using multiple frameworks/libraries to build web applications such as ReactJS, Vue.js, Angular Platform, Redux or similar;
  • Experience in Java build automation technologies such as Gradle, Maven, etc.;
  • Experience with CI/CD platforms such as Bamboo, Jenkins etc.;
  • Experience with IaaS such as AWS, GCP, Azure;
  • Understanding or exposure to Jira in relation to agile task allocation and defect management (desirable);
  • Experience with common front-end development tools such as Webpack, NPM/Yarn, Babel/Rollup, Bash scripting, IDEs such as IntelliJ;
  • Experience in agile delivery;
  • Well-developed oral and written communication skills;
  • Desirable: Experience in a consulting position, preferably working within large, complex and distributed client environments.

Click on the APPLY button now! We thank you for taking interest in this opportunity with us. For a complete list of opportunities with Cognizant visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers .

Job Location : Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Travel : No

Job Posting : Aug 27 2018

About Cognizant

Cognizant (NASDAQ-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us on Twitter: Cognizant.

828319785:
[

Educational Travel Sales Representative

Company Name WorldStrides Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 65 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Passionate about education and travel?\xa0


Eager to share your passion with teachers and educators?


About us


WorldStrides is dedicated to delivering educational travel experiences that fuel dreams for students of all ages. Our educational travel programs immerse students in knowledge culture and undeniable inspiration. WorldStrides has shaped the minds of students through educational travel since 1967 and each year over 400,000 students travel to more than 95 countries on our programs.


The role


We are looking for competitive and self-motivated sales professionals to represent a product that can change people's lives! The Educational Travel Sales Representative (ETSR) is responsible for achieving sales goals through the sale of educational tours to Australian schools. Each ETSR is required to maintain competitive sales numbers and will be responsible for finding prospective clients both within the existing databases and through additional activities.


Responsibilities


  • Solicit new clients and accounts through sales calls and follow up and convert potential sales leads
  • Maintain relationships with existing clients and accounts through the completion of the sale and efficiently respond to all inquiries made by potential clients via phone or email
  • Establish and maintain regular contact with clients and accounts in order to introduce and promote a destination or tour in accordance with company goals, marketing initiatives and sales expectations
  • Identify potential prospects to solicit new business and create a strong pipeline of future business leads
  • Develop a robust sales funnel of leads and prospects to achieve or exceed established sales goals
  • Ensure established monthly and seasonal sales goals are met or exceeded through self-motivation and determination
  • Maintain a detailed, organised and thorough database of teachers, including unqualified, qualified and active leads
  • Ensure CRM is up-to-date at all times
  • Manage and take responsibility for the entire sales process. Work with teachers to set enrolment deadlines for students, helps develop marketing strategies for the teachers to utilise while enrolling students. \xa0
  • Actively seek to develop and improve skills to build performance. Educate yourself on all related tours and WorldStrides products
  • Research and understand the educational travel industry and develop strategies to win business

\xa0

Additional Responsibilities:


  • Identify regional trends, competitive behaviour, promotional effectiveness, and market intelligence
  • Represent WorldStrides at trade association meetings and other related business events to promote all products and services.
  • Coordinates with department Director with the initiation of new marketing ideas and product development ideas


Requirements

  • A bachelor degree
  • 2-3 years progressive sales experience focusing on new business acquisition
  • Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed sales quotas and measurable performance goals
  • Strong communication and presentation skills including the ability to work with all levels of employees and clients in a diplomatic and professional manner
  • The ability to build strong relationships externally and internally
  • The ability to deal with objections
  • Highly self-driven and motivated
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Proficient computer skills and the technical aptitude to master our CRM
  • Ability to multi-task projects and responsibilities and have strong prioritisation skills

\xa0

If this is the sales role you have been looking for, come make your mark on a growing and dynamic company. Qualified candidates should submit their cover letter and CV through LinkedIn.

Refunds Administrator

Company Name Munro Footwear Group Company Location 32 Gipps Street , Collingwood, VIC 3066, AU

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 54 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Munro Footwear Group (MFG) is Australia's leading retailer and wholesaler of footwear, owning and operating Australia's most iconic brands. Our impressive portfolio includes Midas, Mountfords, Wanted, Williams, Mathers as well as Australia's most popular online footwear retailer, Styletread.


Our success is predicated on connecting with consumers in authentic and unexpected ways, while remaining true to the rich heritage of each of our brands. Progressive and forward thinking, we continue to evolve employing over 2,500 people throughout our Support Offices in Port Melbourne & Collingwood and 290+ stores nationally.


We have an exciting opportunity for a highly organised Refunds Administrator to join our Finance Team!


Reporting to our Finance Controller, as our Refunds Administrator you will oversee all aspects of returns for our online stores! This role will see you liaising with our eStore & Chat teams to ensure the return process runs smoothly for our customers.

\xa0

Reporting to the Financial Controller; responsibilities include:

  • Liaising with eStore & Chat teams regarding all return requests
  • Process credit memos and issue refunds efficiently through various payment gateways
  • Monitor and report on Bank Chargebacks and fraudulent activity
  • Monitor and resolve banking issues including fee anomalies and discrepancies
  • Support the preparation of month end journal entries

\xa0

Our Benefits:

  • Employee discount – up to 50% off all Munro Footwear products
  • Join one of Australia's largest footwear retailers
  • Career development opportunities to grow your career!

\xa0

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • A Bachelor Degree in Accounting or equivalent
  • Proficient knowledge in Microsoft Applications; particularly Excel
  • Strong organisational skills and demonstrate attention to detail and accuracy
  • The ability to multitask and prioritise tasks to meet deadlines
  • Great initiative, always looking for ways to improve processes and outcomes
  • Experience with Magento and M3 is an advantage, however not essential

\xa0

This is an exciting entry level opportunity to join our tight knit and supportive finance team. This is the ideal role to join us whilst we continue to grow!


Due to the high volume of applications we receive the vacancy close date may change, don't delay and APPLY NOW!

[

Junior Office Manager

Company Name Bastion Collective Company Location 14-18 Cremorne St, Melbourne, VIC 3121, AU

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 39 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you a bright and enthusiastic individual who is passionate about creating a fun and efficient work environment in an inspiring and collaborative agency environment?


An opportunity exists for a committed and driven Junior Office Manager to join the ever-growing team at Bastion Collective in Melbourne.

Working at the Bastion Collective office in Richmond means working in a fun, fast-paced, challenging, friendly and constantly evolving office.

Bastion Collective is made up of nine communications agencies with expertise spread across government and community, sponsorship activation, events, strategy and integrated PR expertise, reputation management, market insights, TVC production, and promotional merchandise.

We are a tight-knit, high performing, hands-on team who work together to produce the best results for our clients.

The varied responsibilities of the Junior Office Manager means they are the “face” of the business as well as being crucial to day-to-day operations. Exceptional levels of service are expected.

The Junior Office Manager will become an integral part of a fabulous work environment and high performing, fun loving team.

Key responsibilities

  • Manage all front of house tasks including answering telephones and greeting all visitors on arrival
  • Manage all office supplies, suppliers and assess efficiency of providers
  • Manage and maintain all office areas
  • Coordinate couriers, staff rosters and general administrative duties
  • Coordinate maintenance and improvements to office building and interior design
  • Manage OH+S and First Aid officers
  • Manage Bastion Bridge Internship Program as committee chair, \xa0including external marketing, stakeholder management and coordination of all placements end-to-end
  • Hold a seat on Bastion’s culture committee
  • Coordinate business wide social events and activities
  • Act as an ambassador for the Bastion Collective culture ensuring core values are upheld at all times - To make each others lives better everyday, produce world class work that is better every single time and create and run good businesses.

Our ideal candidate

  • You are bright, energetic and eager to add value to all that you do
  • You are incredibly well organised and love to coordinate projects and people
  • You have exceptional interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
  • You have strong attention to detail
  • You love to work in fast paced, dynamic environment
  • You are flexible, and nimble, and you love keeping all the balls in the air
  • You love to work independently and as part of a team
  • You understand the importance of maintaining discretion and confidentiality of Bastion Collective and its clients
  • You are willing and able to pick up new software and programs as needed
  • You love to make the lives of those you work with easier
  • You like to consistently foster a strong team environment
  • You have a calm, tenacious but polite personality that never gives in or gives up until they get an answer\xa0
  • You love to have fun

IT Skills
Google Apps – Gmail, Google Drive

What we can offer you

An opportunity to work as part of an integrated team delivering social campaigns and strategy on behalf of a global brand. You will be part of a team of hardworking professionals who are committed to nurturing growth and helping you develop your career.\xa0


As part of the Bastion Collective, we offer a range of unique benefits, including the ability to apply for our bespoke Bastion Degree course where you’ll learn to become the best and most impactful, high performance version of yourself.
\xa0

If this sounds like it might be right for you, please submit an expression of interest along with your current CV to recruitment@bastioncollective.com
